attributes.description: Displays all the unique cluster names in the data set along with a summary of the number of files and directories in that cluster. Cluster names are a clickable link to filter the data set to a particular cluster.
attributes.title: Clusters in data set

attributes.description: Display the total number of files in the data set.
attributes.title: Total objects - Files

attributes.description: Display the total number of directories in the data set.
attributes.title: Total objects - Directories

attributes.description: Display the total application logical capacity consumed on the cluster based on the data set. The application logical capacity is the file size that an end user expects to see down to the byte. Sparse files will show as the full size of the sparse file and not just the actual used portion. This value does not include metadata overhead or data protection overhead.
attributes.title: Total used capacity - Application

attributes.description: Display the total physical capacity consumed on the cluster based on the data set. The physical capacity includes the data blocks (8KiB block aligned), the protection overhead, and the metadata overhead for each file.
attributes.title: Total used capacity - Physical

attributes.description: Display the total number of files tiered using CloudPools in the data set.
attributes.title: Total objects - CloudPools tiered

attributes.description: Display the total number of files that have NTFS ACL permissions in the data set.
attributes.title: Total objects - Files with ACLs

attributes.description: Display the total number of directories that have NTFS ACL permissions in the data set.
attributes.title: Total objects - Directories with ACLs

attributes.description: Display the total number of files that have a hard link in the data set. If 5 files have a hard link to the same underlying file, this panel will report 5. The panel does not display the number of unique objects.
attributes.title: Total objects - Files with hardlinks

attributes.description: Calculate the total number of files grouped by file size ranges.
attributes.title: File size distribution - Count

attributes.description: Calculate the total storage consumed by files, grouped by file size ranges.
attributes.title: File size distribution - Capacity

attributes.description: Calculate both the total number of files and the total storage consumed by files, grouped by file size ranges.
attributes.title: File count and capacity by size distribution

attributes.description: Calculate the total number of files, grouped by the file last access time.
attributes.title: File count by access time

attributes.description: Calculate the total storage consumed by files, grouped by the file last access time.
attributes.title: Capacity consumed by access time

attributes.description: Calculate both the total file count and the total storage consumed by files, grouped by the file last access time.
attributes.title: File count and capacity by access time

attributes.description: Calculate the total number of files, grouped by the file last modified time.
attributes.title: File count by last modified time

attributes.description: Calculate total storage consumed by files, grouped by the file last modified time.
attributes.title: Capacity consumed by last modified time

attributes.description: Calculate both the total file count and the total storage consumed by files, grouped by the file last modified time.
attributes.title: File count and capacity by last modified time

attributes.description: Count the total number of files based on the file extension.
attributes.title: File count by file extension

attributes.description: Count the total capacity consumed by files based on the file extension.
attributes.title: Capacity consumed by file extension

attributes.description: Calculate the total number of files, grouped by file extension categories. Each category is defined by a regular expression, which determines which files belong to that category based on their extensions.
attributes.title: File count by category

attributes.description: Calculate the total storage consumed by files, grouped by file extension categories. Each category is defined by a regular expression, which determines which files belong to that category based on their extensions.
attributes.title: Capacity consumed by category

attributes.description: Calculate both the total number of files and the total storage consumed by files, grouped by file extension categories. Each category is defined by a regular expression, which determines which files belong to that category based on their extensions.
attributes.title: File count and capacity by category

attributes.description:
This panel shows the number of files and application logical size consumed by all the files in a set of configured paths.

The paths are defined as filters on the data.file.path field. Additional paths can be added as desired.
attributes.title: Path based consumption

attributes.description:
This panel shows the number of files and application logical size consumed by all the files in a set of configured paths.

The paths are defined as filters on the data.file.path field. Additional paths can be added as desired.

The data is further broken up into 3 categories, Flash, Hybrid, and Archive according to the data.data_nodepool.name field. The panel assumes the default naming for node pools based on the hardware in the pool.

filter.query: data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /f[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(d|hd?|s|x)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(a|nl?)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /f[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(a|nl?)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(d|hd?|s|x)[0-9]+.*/i

attributes.title: Path based consumption by node pool

attributes.description:
This panel shows the number of files and application logical size consumed by all the files in a set of configured paths.

The paths are defined as filters on the data.file.path field. Additional paths can be added as desired.

For each path, the top N users consuming the capacity are displayed.

For each path and user, the data is further broken up into 3 categories, Flash, Hybrid, and Archive according to the data.data_nodepool.name field. The panel assumes the default naming for node pools based on the hardware in the pool.

filter.query: data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /f[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(d|hd?|s|x)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(a|nl?)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /f[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(a|nl?)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(d|hd?|s|x)[0-9]+.*/i

attributes.title: Path based consumption by user and node pool (Top 10)

attributes.description:
Display the top users consuming capacity within the data set. The output provides the file count and the total capacity.

The data is further refined based on a set of path filters. For each path filter, the usage within that path is displayed. The paths are defined as filters on the data.file.path field. Additional paths can be added as desired.

The data is further broken up into 3 categories, Flash, Hybrid, and Archive according to the data.data_nodepool.name field. The panel assumes the default naming for node pools based on the hardware in the pool.

filter.query: data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /f[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(d|hd?|s|x)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(a|nl?)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /f[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(a|nl?)[0-9]+.*/i
data.file_type: "regular" AND NOT data.user_flags: "ssmartlinked" AND data.data_nodepool.name: /(d|hd?|s|x)[0-9]+.*/i

attributes.title: User consumption by node pool and path (Top 10)

attributes.description: Display the total number of files that have an Alternate Data Stream (ADS).
attributes.title: Total objects - Files with Alternate Data Stream

attributes.description: Display the total number of files that have an NTFS owner or group in the data set.
attributes.title: Total objects - Files with NTFS Owner/Group
